module.name: global
module.description: Global parameters for all trunk applications.

parameter.name: agencyID
parameter.description: Agency ID used to set creationInfo.agencyID in data model objects. Should not contain spaces.

parameter.name: datacenterID
parameter.description: Datacenter ID which is primarily used by Arclink and its tools. Should not contain spaces.

parameter.name: organization
parameter.description: Organization name used mainly by ArcLink and SeedLink.

parameter.name: author
parameter.description: Author name used to set creationInfo.author in data model objects. @appname@ is replace by the name of the respective executable, @hostname@ by the name of the computer on which it runs.

parameter.name: plugins
parameter.description: List of plugins loaded at startup. Separate multiple names by comma. Add ${plugins} to consider all previously read values.

parameter.name: cityXML
parameter.description: Path to the cities XML file. If undefined, the data is read from "@CONFIGDIR@/cities.xml" or "@DATADIR@/cities.xml". SeisComP ships with "@DATADIR@/cities.xml".

parameter.name: loadCities
parameter.description: Load cities from file configured by the "cityXML" parameter. GUI and map applications enable loading of cities by default considering the parameter "scheme.map.showCities".

parameter.name: loadRegions
parameter.description: Load custom FEP (Flinn-Engdahl polygon) regions from "@CONFIGDIR@/fep/" or @DATADIR@/fep/". GUI and map applications and scevent enable FEP regions by default. Explicitly uncheck the option to disregard by these applications.

parameter.name: publicIDPattern
configModule
parameter.description: Name of the configuration module.

parameter.name: database
parameter.description:
Defines the database connection. If no database is configured (which is the default) and a messaging connection is available, the application will receive the parameters after the connection is established. Override these values only if you know what you are doing.
The format is: service://user:pwd@host/database. "service" is the name of the database driver which can be queried with "--db-driver-list".
Note that this parameter overrides 'database.type' and 'database.parameters' if present.

parameter.name: recordstream
parameter.description:
SeisComP applications access waveform data through the RecordStream interface. Please consult the SeisComP documentation for a list of supported services and their configuration.
This parameter configures recordstream source URL, format: [service://]location[#type]. "service" is the name of the recordstream implementation. If "service" is not given "file://" is implied.
This parameter overrides the deprecated recordstream.service and recordstream.source and should be used instead.

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: Sets the logging level between 1 and 4 where 1=ERROR, 2=WARNING, 3=INFO and 4=DEBUG.

parameter.name: file
parameter.description: Enables logging into a log file.

parameter.name: syslog
parameter.description: Enables logging to syslog if supported by the host system.

parameter.name: components
parameter.description: Limit the logging to the specified list of components e.g. 'Application, Server'

parameter.name: component
parameter.description: For each log entry print the component right after the log level. By default the component output is enabled for file output but disabled for console output.

parameter.name: context
parameter.description: For each log entry print the source file name and line number.

parameter.name: utc
parameter.description: Use UTC instead of localtime in logging timestamps.

parameter.name: rotator
parameter.description: Enables rotation of log files.

parameter.name: timeSpan
parameter.description: Time span after which a log file is rotated.

parameter.name: archiveSize
parameter.description: How many historic log files to keep.

parameter.name: maxFileSize
parameter.description: The maximum size of a logfile in byte. The default value is 100 megabyte. If a logfile exceeds that size, then it is rotated. To disable the size limit give 0 or a negative value.

parameter.name: timeSpan
parameter.description: Timespan for counting input/output of objects.

parameter.name: facility
parameter.description: Defines the syslog facility to be used according to the defined facility names in syslog.h. The default is local0. If the given name is invalid or not available, initializing logging will fail and the application quits.

parameter.name: server
parameter.description:
Defines the URL of the messaging server to connect to. URL format is [scheme://]host[:port][/queue]. Default scheme: scmp, default port: 18180, default queue: production. Examples:
All default: localhost
Specfic host: scmp://10.0.1.4:18180/production
Specfic host and SSL encryption: scmps://10.0.1.4:18180/production

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: Defines the username to be used. The length is maybe limited by the messaging system used. By default the module name (name of the executable) is used but sometimes it exceeds the 10 character limit and access is denied. To prevent errors set a different username. An empty username will let the system to generate one.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: The connection timeout in seconds. 3 seconds are normally more than enough. If a client needs to connect to a remote system with a slow connection, a larger timeout might be needed.

parameter.name: primaryGroup
parameter.description: Defines the primary group of a module. This is the name of the group where a module sends its messages to if the target group is not explicitely given in the send call.

parameter.name: contentType
parameter.description: Defines the message encoding for sending. Allowed values are "binary", "json" or "xml". XML has more overhead in processing but is more robust when schema versions between client and server are different.

parameter.name: subscriptions
parameter.description: Defines a list of message groups to subscribe to. The default is usually given by the application and does not need to be changed.

group.name: database
group.description: Defines the database connection. If no database is configured (which is the default) and a messaging connection is available, the application will receive the parameters after the connection is established. Override these values only if you know what you are doing.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Defines the database backend to be used. The name corresponds to the defined name in the database plugin. Examples are: mysql, postgresql or sqlite3. Note that this parameter is deprecated. Please use the URL form 'database = mysql://sysop:sysop@localhost/seiscomp' instead.

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.description: The database connection parameters. This value depends on the used database backend. E.g. sqlite3 expects the path to the database file whereas MYSQL or PostgreSQL expect an URI in the format user:pwd@host/database?param1=val1&param2=val2. Note that this parameter is deprecated. Please use the URL form 'database = mysql://sysop:sysop@localhost/seiscomp' instead.

parameter.name: inventory
parameter.description: Load the inventory database from a given XML file if set. This overrides the inventory definitions loaded from the database backend.

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: Load the configuration database from a given XML file if set. This overrides the configuration definitions loaded from the database backend.

parameter.name: agencies
parameter.description: Defines a whitelist of agencies that are allowed for processing. Separate items by comma.

parameter.name: agencies
parameter.description: Defines a blacklist of agencies that are not allowed for processing. Separate items by comma.

parameter.name: nettype
parameter.description: List of network types to include when loading the inventory.

parameter.name: statype
parameter.description: List of station types to include when loading the inventory.

parameter.name: nettype
parameter.description: List of network types to exclude when loading the inventory.

parameter.name: statype
parameter.description: List of station types to exclude when loading the inventory.

group.name: recordstream
group.description: SeisComP applications access waveform data through the RecordStream interface. Please consult the SeisComP documentation for a list of supported services and their configuration. Note that this set of parameters is deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Please use the URL form (recordstream = slink://localhost) in future.

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: Name of the RecordStream service implementation.

parameter.name: source
parameter.description: Service specific parameters like a IP address or a file name to use.

parameter.name: crashHandler
parameter.description: Path to crash handler script

parameter.name: plugins
parameter.description: Defines a list of core modules loaded at startup.

parameter.name: startStopMessage
parameter.description: Enables sending of an application start- and stop message to the STATUS_GROUP.

parameter.name: autoShutdown
parameter.description: Enables automatic application shutdown triggered by a status message.

parameter.name: shutdownMasterModule
parameter.description: Triggers shutdown if the module name of the received messages match

parameter.name: shutdownMasterUsername
parameter.description: Triggers shutdown if the user name of the received messages match

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: A regular expression of all clients that should handle a command message usually send to the GUI messaging group. Currently this flag is only used by GUI applications to set an artificial origin and to tell other clients to show this origin. To let all connected clients handle the command, ".*$" can be used.

group.name: ttt
group.description: Travel time table related configuration. Travel time tables can be added via plugins. Built-in interfaces are LOCSAT and libtau. For each loaded interface a list of supported models must be provided.

parameter.name: tables
parameter.description: The list of supported model names per interface.

group.name: magnitudes
group.description: Magnitude configurations overriding global bindings. Add regionalization by magnitude-type profiles. Profile names correspond to magnitude types.

parameter.name: regions
parameter.description: Path to a BNA file with one or more polygons defining geographic regions. Each region allows further magnitude parametrization. The order of polygons/regions matters. The list is tested from front to back and the first hit wins. Magnitude-region profiles refer to the polygons by the name of the profile. The special name "world" must not be present in the BNA file.

group.name: region
group.description:
Add parameter profiles for regions defined in the BNA file. Profile names must match one polygon name. Otherwise the profile is not considered. The special name "world" corresponds to the region of the entire planet as a fallback.
Magnitude-specific parameters, e.g. calibration functions, are adjusted in a separate section of magnitudes with the same name.

parameter.name: enable
parameter.description: Enable the region or not.

parameter.name: minDist
parameter.description: The minimum distance required to compute a magnitude. This settings has no effect with e.g. scautopick as there is no information about the source of the event to compute the distance. The default value is implementation specific.

parameter.name: maxDist
parameter.description: The maximum distance allowed to compute a magnitude. This settings has no effect with e.g. scautopick as there is no information about the source of the event to compute the distance. The default value is implementation specific.

parameter.name: minDepth
parameter.description: The minimum depth required to compute a magnitude. This settings has no effect with e.g. scautopick as there is no information about the source of the event to retrieve the depth. The default value is implementation specific.

parameter.name: maxDepth
parameter.description: The maximum depth allowed to compute a magnitude. This settings has no effect with e.g. scautopick as there is no information about the source of the event to retrieve the depth. The default value is implementation specific.

parameter.name: check
parameter.description:
Defines how the region check is performed to accept a source receiver pair for further processing. Allowed values are:
source: Only the source/origin must be within the region.
source-receiver: Both source/origin and receiver/station must be within the region.
raypath: The entire path between source/origin and receiver/station must be withing the region.

parameter.name: multiplier
parameter.description: Linear part of the default station correction for this region.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.description: Constant part of the default station correction for this region.

input.name: organization
input.description: This is used mainly by SeedLink and Arclink to identify the server organization. Also, the ArcLink full SEED volumes will have this organization value set.

binding.name: general
binding.description: Configures global parameters of a station for modules.

parameter.name: detecLocid
parameter.description: The sensor location code of the preferred stream used e.g. by scautopick and scrttv.

parameter.name: detecStream
parameter.description: The channel code of the preferred stream used by e.g. scautopick and scrttv. If no component code is given, the vertical component will be fetched from inventory considering the channel orientation (azimuth, dip). If that approach fails, 'Z' will be appended and used as fallback. Do not use regular expressions!

group.name: amplitudes
group.description: Define general parameters for amplitudes of a certain type. Create amplitude type profiles to define the time windows, minimum signal-to-noise ratio, amplitude thresholds and restitution for measuring amplitudes of a certain type.

parameter.name: saturationThreshold
parameter.description:
Defines the saturation threshold for the optional saturation check. By default the saturation check is disabled but giving a value above 0 will enable it. Waveforms that are saturated are not used for amplitude calculations.
This value can either be an absolute value of counts such as "100000" counts or a relative value (optionally in percent) with respect to the number of effective bits, e.g. "0.8@23" or "80%@23". The first version uses 1**23 * 0.8 whereas the latter uses 1**23 * 80/100.
The boolean value "false" explicitly disables the check.

parameter.name: enable
parameter.description: Defines if amplitude calculation is enabled. If disabled, this station will be skipped for amplitudes and magnitudes.

parameter.name: enableResponses
parameter.description: Activates deconvolution for this station. If no responses are configured, an error is raised and the data is not processed. This flag will be overridden by the type specific flag (see Amplitude type profile).

group.name: resp
group.description: Several parameters if usage of full responses is enabled. The parameters of this group will be overridden by type specific settings if given (see Amplitude type profile).

parameter.name: taper
parameter.description: Defines the length of the taper at either side of the waveform. The length will be added to the data request: start - taper and end + taper.

parameter.name: minFreq
parameter.description: After data are converted in to the frequency domain that minimum frequency defines the end of the left-side cosine taper for the frequency spectrum. The taper applies from 0 Hz to {minFreq} Hz. A value of 0 or lower disables that taper.

parameter.name: maxFreq
parameter.description: After data are converted in to the frequency domain that maximum frequency defines the start of the right-side cosine taper for the frequency spectrum. The taper applies from {maxFreq} Hz to {fNyquist} Hz. A value of 0 or lower disables that taper.

group.name: WoodAnderson
group.description: Allows to configure the Wood-Anderson seismometer response. The default values are according to the version of Gutenberg (1935). The newer version by Uhrhammer and Collins (1990) is part of the IASPEI Magnitude Working Group recommendations of 2011 September 9. This version uses gain=2800, T0=0.8 s, h=0.8.

parameter.name: gain
parameter.description: The gain of the Wood-Anderson response.

parameter.name: T0
parameter.description: The eigen period of the Wood-Anderson seismometer.

parameter.name: h
parameter.description: The damping constant of the Wood-Anderson seismometer.

struct.description: An amplitude profile configures global parameters for a particular amplitude type. The available amplitude types are not fixed and can be extended by plugins. The name of the type must match the one defined in the corresponding AmplitudeProcessor.

parameter.name: saturationThreshold
parameter.description:
Defines the saturation threshold for the optional saturation check. By default the saturation check is disabled but giving a value above 0 will enable it. Waveforms that are saturated are not used for amplitude calculations.
This value can either be an absolute value of counts such as "100000" counts or a relative value (optionally in percent) with respect to the number of effective bits, e.g. "0.8@23" or "80%@23". The first version uses 1**23 * 0.8 whereas the latter uses 1**23 * 80/100.
The boolean value "false" explicitly disables the check.

parameter.name: enable
parameter.description: Defines if amplitude calculation of certain type is enabled.

parameter.name: enableResponses
parameter.description: Activates deconvolution for this amplitude type. If not set, the global flag "amplitudes.enableResponses" will be used instead.

parameter.name: minSNR
parameter.description: Defines the mininum SNR to be reached to compute the amplitudes. This value is amplitude type specific and has no global default value.

parameter.name: noiseBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the begin of the noise window used to compute the noise offset and noise amplitude. Each amplitude processor sets its own noise time window and this option should only be changed if you know what you are doing.

parameter.name: noiseEnd
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the end of the noise window used to compute the noise offset and noise amplitude. Each amplitude processor sets its own noise time window and this option should only be changed if you know what you are doing.

parameter.name: signalBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the begin of the signal window used to compute the final amplitude. Each amplitude processor sets its own signal time window and this option should only be changed if you know what you are doing.

parameter.name: signalEnd
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the end of the signal window used to compute the final amplitude. Each amplitude processor sets its own signal time window and this option should only be changed if you know what you are doing.

parameter.name: minDist
parameter.description: The minimum distance required to compute an amplitude. This settings has no effect with e.g. scautopick as there is no information about the source of the event to compute the distance. The default value is implementation specific.

parameter.name: maxDist
parameter.description: The maximum distance allowed to compute an amplitude. This settings has no effect with e.g. scautopick as there is no information about the source of the event to compute the distance. The default value is implementation specific.

parameter.name: minDepth
parameter.description: The minimum depth required to compute an amplitude. This settings has no effect with e.g. scautopick as there is no information about the source of the event to retrieve the depth. The default value is implementation specific.

parameter.name: maxDepth
parameter.description: The maximum depth allowed to compute an amplitude. This settings has no effect with e.g. scautopick as there is no information about the source of the event to retrieve the depth. The default value is implementation specific.

parameter.name: regionalize
parameter.description:
Controls if the amplitude calculation should be regionalized or not. The regions and their configuration are taken from the corresponding magnitude profiles. If regionalization is activate, then e.g. modules without origin information will not be able to compute an amplitude as the origin is required to determine the effective settings.
If amplitudes for this particular type shall be computed regardless of any defined regions, set this parameter to false.

group.name: resp
group.description: Several parameters if usage of full responses is enabled.

parameter.name: taper
parameter.description: Defines the length of the taper at either side of the waveform. The length will be added to the data request: start - taper and end + taper.

parameter.name: minFreq
parameter.description: After data are converted in to the frequency domain that minimum frequency defines the end of the left-side cosine taper for the frequency spectrum. The taper applies from 0 Hz to {minFreq} Hz. A value of 0 or lower disables that taper.

parameter.name: maxFreq
parameter.description: After data are converted in to the frequency domain that maximum frequency defines the start of the right-side cosine taper for the frequency spectrum. The taper applies from {maxFreq} Hz to {fNyquist} Hz. A value of 0 or lower disables that taper.

group.name: magnitudes
group.description: Define magnitude parameters independent of amplitude-type profiles. For magnitude correction parameters, e.g. network of station corrections, create a magnitude type profile.

struct.description: A magnitude profile configures global parameters for a particular magnitude type. The available magnitude types are not fixed and can be extended by plugins. The name of the type must match the one defined in the corresponding MagnitudeProcessor.

parameter.name: multiplier
parameter.description: Part of the magnitude station correction. The final magnitude value is multiplier*M+offset. This value can be regionalized with name-value pairs. The name is the name of the region. Without a name the value is the default without regionalization. Example: "1.0, regionA: 0.9, regionB: 1.1".

parameter.name: offset
parameter.description: Part of the magnitude station correction. The final magnitude value is multiplier*M+offset. This value can be regionalized with name-value pairs. The name is the name of the region. Without a name the value is the default without regionalization. Example: "0.0, regionA: -0.1, regionB: 0.2".

group.name: picker
group.description: Parameters controlling the second-stage picker for re-picking P phases after an initial detection.

group.name: AIC
group.description: AIC picker is an implementation using the simple non-AR algorithm of Maeda (1985), see paper of Zhang et al. (2003) in BSSA. The picker interface name to be used in configuration files, e.g. of scautopick, is "AIC".

parameter.name: noiseBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the relative data acquisition time (relative to the triggering pick). This adds a margin to the actual processing and is useful to initialize the filter (e.g. bandpass). The data is not used at all until signalBegin is reached. The data time window start is the minimum of noiseBegin and signalBegin.

parameter.name: signalBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the begin of the signal window used to pick.

parameter.name: signalEnd
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the begin of the signal window used to pick.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.description: Overrides the default filter which is "raw". The typical filter grammar can be used.

parameter.name: minSNR
parameter.description: Mininum SNR as returned from AIC for accepting picks.

group.name: BK
group.description: Bkpicker is an implementation of the Baer/Kradolfer picker adapted to SeisComP. It was created by converting Manfred Baers from Fortran to C++ and inserting it as a replacement for the picker algorithm. The picker interface name to be used in configuration files, e.g. of scautopick,is "BK".

parameter.name: noiseBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the relative data acquisition time (relative to the triggering pick). This adds a margin to the actual processing and is useful to initialize the filter (e.g. bandpass). The data is not used at all until signalBegin is reached. The data time window start is the minimum of noiseBegin and signalBegin.

parameter.name: signalBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the begin of the signal window used to pick.

parameter.name: signalEnd
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the begin of the signal window used to pick.

parameter.name: filterType
parameter.description: BP (Bandpass) is currently the only option.

parameter.name: filterPoles
parameter.description: Number of poles.

parameter.name: f1
parameter.description: Bandpass lower cutoff freq. in Hz.

parameter.name: f2
parameter.description: Bandpass upper cutoff freq. in Hz.

parameter.name: thrshl1
parameter.description: Threshold to trigger for pick (c.f. paper), default 10

parameter.name: thrshl2
parameter.description: Threshold for updating sigma (c.f. paper), default 20

group.name: spicker
group.description: Parameters controlling the secondary picker, e.g for picking S phases.

group.name: L2
group.description: L2 is an algorithm to pick S-phases based on existing P-phases. It works by creating the L2 norm of the two filtered horizontal components and then running the `detecFilter` on the L2 trace to find the S pick. Finally AIC is applied around the detected pick time to refine the detection. The picker name to be used in configuration files is "S-L2".

parameter.name: noiseBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the relative data processing start time (relative to the triggering pick). This adds a margin to the actual processing and is useful to initialize the filter (e.g. bandpass). The data is not used at all until signalBegin is reached. The data time window start is the minimum of noiseBegin and signalBegin.

parameter.name: signalBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the relative start time (relative to the triggering pick) of the begin of the signal processing.

parameter.name: signalEnd
parameter.description: Overrides the relative end time (relative to the triggering pick) of the end of the signal window used to pick.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.description: Configures the filter used to process the horizontal components traces before computing the L2-norm.

parameter.name: detecFilter
parameter.description: Configures the detector filter applied on the filtered L2 trace.

parameter.name: threshold
parameter.description: The detector threshold that triggers the AIC picker.

parameter.name: timeCorr
parameter.description: The time correction (in seconds) added to the detection time before AIC time window is computed.

parameter.name: marginAIC
parameter.description: The AIC time window around the detection used to pick. If 0, AIC is not used.

parameter.name: minSNR
parameter.description: Minimum SNR as returned from AIC for accepting picks.

group.name: V
group.description: This S-picker works similarly to L2 but it only uses the vertical component to pick S-phases. The picker name to use is configuration files is "S-V"

parameter.name: noiseBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the relative data processing start time (relative to the triggering pick). This adds a margin to the actual processing and is useful to initialize the filter (e.g. bandpass). The data is not used at all until signalBegin is reached. The data time window start is the minimum of noiseBegin and signalBegin.

parameter.name: signalBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the relative start time (relative to the triggering pick) of the begin of the signal processing.

parameter.name: signalEnd
parameter.description: Overrides the relative end time (relative to the triggering pick) of the end of the signal window used to pick.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.description: Configures the filter used to process the raw vertical component data

parameter.name: detecFilter
parameter.description: Configures the detector filter applied on filtered data.

parameter.name: threshold
parameter.description: The detector threshold that triggers the AIC picker.

parameter.name: timeCorr
parameter.description: The time correction (in seconds) added to the detection time before AIC time window is computed.

parameter.name: marginAIC
parameter.description: The AIC time window around the detection used to pick. If 0 AIC is not used.

parameter.name: minSNR
parameter.description: Defines the mininum SNR as returned from AIC.
